meanings.definition: The state or condition of being stunted in growth or development.
meanings.sent1: The stuntedness of the plant was evident in its small size and lack of leaves.
meanings.sent2: The stuntedness of the child's growth concerned the parents, prompting them to seek medical advice.
meanings.sent3: The stuntedness of the tree made it the perfect fit for the tiny garden gnome to sit on.
meanings.sent4: The stuntedness of progress in the project was like hitting a roadblock every step of the way.
meanings.sent5: The stuntedness of the puppy's legs made it adorable but also a bit clumsy.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being stunted in growth or development.
meanings.sent1: She observed the stuntedness of the flowers, noting their lack of vibrant colors and full bloom.
meanings.sent2: The stuntedness of his intellectual growth was evident in his struggle to grasp basic concepts.
meanings.sent3: The stuntedness of the cake's rise in the oven left it looking more like a pancake.
meanings.sent4: The stuntedness of creativity in the room was palpable, stifling any new ideas from emerging.
meanings.sent5: The stuntedness of the building's design made it stand out in a neighborhood of towering skyscrapers.
